title: Newcastle interested in signing Guilherme Siqueria and Lucas Orban for problem left-back position as club also hunt new striker
title_page: Newcastle interested in signing Guilherme Siqueria and Lucas Orban for problem left-back position as club also hunt new striker    | Daily Mail Online
text:
Newcastle are interested in Atletico Madrid left-back Guilherme Siqueira.
The Magpies have enquired about a potential loan switch until the end of the season.
Steve McClaren wants to add a new left-back to his ranks and believes Siqueira fits the bill.
Newcastle are interested in Atletico Madrid left-back Guilherme Siqueira (right)
Valencia left-back Lucas Orban (left) is also on the radar for Steve McClaren's struggling side
Newcastle have also looked at Valencia left-back Lucas Orban.
The 26-year-old is an Argentina international and well known to Newcastle coach Ian Cathro who worked at Valencia as assistant to former manager Nuno.
Orban joined Valencia from Bordeaux for £2.5million in 2014 but started out at River Plate. He can also play at centre-back and has made 12 appearances this season with his last coming in Valencia's 3-0 Copa del Rey win over Granada earlier this month.
They face competition though from other Premier League sides who are looking for cover at full-back and are talking to Orban's representatives.
Newcastle are pushing hard to sign a striker before Monday's deadline and have opened discussions with Roma over a loan move for Ivorian striker Seydou Doumbia.
The clubs are close to finalising terms for a deal that could see him move permanently in the summer for £7m, and Doumbia is due to fly to England for talks on Saturday.
